title: Steven Skaggs
content:
Steven Skaggs studied calligraphy and typography under [Hermann Zapf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hermann%20Zapf). His calligraphic artworks are in the collections of the [Klingspor Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Klingspor%20Museum), [Offenbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Offenbach) Germany, the [Sackner Archive](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Sackner%20Archive) of Visual and Concrete Poetry in Miami, and the [Akademie der Künst](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Akademie%20der%20K%C3%BCnst), Berlin. He has been active giving workshops and teaching throughout the United States as well as Canada, Italy, Switzerland and Germany. Steven Skaggs lives in [Louisville](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Louisville), [Kentucky](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kentucky) where he is Professor of Design at the [Hite Art Institute](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hite%20Art%20Institute), University of Louisville.

Skaggs designed [Rieven Uncial](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rieven%20Uncial) in 2009, which was awarded a Certificate of Excellence in Typographic Design in the [TDC2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012171755/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TDC2) 2010.
